segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
2. Caravagga
11. Carasutta
“Carato cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while walking.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti, carampi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.
segments.en: They tolerate it and don’t give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it. Such a mendicant is said to be ‘not keen or prudent, always lazy, and lacking energy’ when walking.

segments.pli: Ṭhitassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
segments.en: Suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while standing …

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti, ṭhitopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.
Nisinnassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti, nisinnopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.
Sayānassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno jāgarassa uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
segments.en: or when lying down while awake.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu adhivāseti, nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti, sayānopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu jāgaro evaṃbhūto ‘anātāpī anottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ kusīto hīnavīriyo’ti vuccati.
segments.en: They tolerate it and don’t give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it. Such a mendicant is said to be ‘not keen or prudent, always lazy, and lacking energy’ when lying down while awake.

segments.pli: Carato cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
segments.en: Suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while walking.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
segments.en: They don’t tolerate it, but give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

segments.pli: carampi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccati.
segments.en: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and determined’ when walking.

segments.pli: Ṭhitassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
segments.en: Suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or cruel thought while standing …

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
ṭhitopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccati.
Nisinnassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
nisinnopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccati.
Sayānassa cepi, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno jāgarassa uppajjati kāmavitakko vā byāpādavitakko vā vihiṃsāvitakko vā.
segments.en: or when lying down while awake.

segments.pli: Tañce bhikkhu nādhivāseti, pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
segments.en: They don’t tolerate it, but give it up, get rid of it, eliminate it, and obliterate it.

segments.pli: sayānopi, bhikkhave, bhikkhu jāgaro evaṃbhūto ‘ātāpī ottāpī satataṃ samitaṃ āraddhavīriyo pahitatto’ti vuccatīti.
segments.en: Such a mendicant is said to be ‘keen and prudent, always energetic and determined’ when lying down while awake.”

segments.pli: Caraṃ vā yadi vā tiṭṭhaṃ,
nisinno uda vā sayaṃ;
Yo vitakkaṃ vitakketi,
segments.en: if you think a bad thought

segments.pli: pāpakaṃ gehanissitaṃ.
segments.en: to do with the lay life,

segments.pli: Kummaggappaṭipanno so,
Mohaneyyesu mucchito;
Abhabbo tādiso bhikkhu,
Phuṭṭhuṃ sambodhimuttamaṃ.
Yo ca caraṃ vā tiṭṭhaṃ vā,
segments.en: But one who, whether standing or walking,

segments.pli: Nisinno uda vā sayaṃ;
Vitakkaṃ samayitvāna,
Vitakkūpasame rato;
Bhabbo so tādiso bhikkhu,
Phuṭṭhuṃ sambodhimuttaman”ti.
Paṭhamaṃ.

sections.title: “Mendicants, suppose a mendicant has a sensual, malicious, or…

suttaplex.blurb: A mendicant gets rid of unwholesome states right away, in whatever posture they happen to be in.
